page.title: 08Upperwood Hall
page.content: Upperwood Hall was built in 1835 by a Mr Beaumont. It has had 3 other names: Wood Hall, Overwood Hall and finally Upperwood Hall. The building was at first a manor house but when bought by a Mr Taylor it was made into 7 flats. The Hall was not part of Darfield until Ideal Homes bought it and built a large new estate nearby. Living in one of the flats were Mr and Mrs Adams. In order to prevent the old house from being completely surrounded by new buildings they bought Upperwood and have since renovated and modernised its interior. In 1974 a school was built next to the Hall but it still retains its privacy by means of tall hedges. Mrs Adams keeps her garden in good trim and encourages wild life by leaving part of the garden wild.
